class.name: Algorithms and Data Structures
class.description: Implementation of basic data structures, including stacks, queues, lists, priority queues, trees, binary search trees, graphs, and sets. Recursion. Efficient sorting and searching algorithms. Hashing. Multithreaded programs. Computer Sciences 315 and 315H may not both be counted.

class.description: Introduction to computer science concepts. Programming in a modern object-oriented programming language. Computer Sciences 303E and 305J may not both be counted. Credit for Computer Sciences 305J may not be earned after a student has received credit for Computer Sciences 307.

class.name: Foundations of Computer Science
class.description: Fundamental computer science concepts: data types, data structures, algorithms, and programming; functions and recursion; abstraction and encapsulation.
